cleaned_text: Home The Emory Office of Spiritual and Religious Life is a university-wide office charged with supporting Emory's religious and philosophical diversity. Multi-Faith Baccalaureate Ceremony Baccalaureate is an Emory Commencement tradition that formally celebrates the academic and personal journeys of the graduating senior class with music, prayers, inspiring reflections, and blessings. [Baccalaureate Ceremony](programs/2018-baccalaureate.html) Remembrances The Emory University Office of Spiritual and Religious Life (OSRL) is honored to assist the Emory community with responding to the passing of students, faculty, and staff members when appropriate.
